question:
In recent times, there have been proposals to change India's financial year from April-March to January-December. What are the possible advantages this change can provide?
  1. It can enhance the responsiveness of the government to a bad monsoon
  2. It can align India's statistical data with United Nations reporting standards
  3. Financial year and agricultural crop year will be same
  4. Financial years of government and RBI will be same
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: It can enhance the responsiveness of the government to a bad monsoon This is correct statement. The budget allocations are made in February/ March and generally itâ€™s too late. It can align India's statistical data with United Nations reporting standards This is also a correct statement and is an argument of NITI Aayog. Financial year and agricultural crop year will be same This is incorrect. Agricultural crop year in India is from July to 30 June. Financial years of government and RBI will be same This is incorrect. Financial year in RBI is also July to June.
